books.title: DEMON COPPERHEAD

books.author: John Scalzi
books.description: A down on his luck substitute teacher is helped by unionized dolphins and a terrifying henchperson to tackle the heap of troubles he inherits along with his uncle’s supervillain business. Read by Wil Wheaton. 8 hours, 5 minutes unabridged.
books.title: STARTER VILLAIN

books.author: James McBride
books.description: Secrets held by the residents of a dilapidated neighborhood come to life when a skeleton is found at the bottom of a well. Read by Dominic Hoffman. 12 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE HEAVEN & EARTH GROCERY STORE

books.author: Ken Follett
books.description: The fifth book in the Kingsbridge series. Change and turmoil affect various aspects of society in the latter part of the 18th century. Read by John Lee. 21 hours, 39 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE ARMOR OF LIGHT

books.author: Nina Simon
books.description: When her granddaughter finds a dead body while kayaking, a convalescing Los Angeles businesswoman tries to uncover the truth. Read by Jane Oppenheimer. 12 hours, 38 minutes unabridged.
books.title: MOTHER-DAUGHTER MURDER NIGHT

books.author: Britney Spears
books.description: The Grammy Award-winning pop star details her personal and professional experiences, including the years she spent under a conservatorship overseen by her father. Read by Michelle Williams. 5 hours, 31 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE WOMAN IN ME

books.author: David Grann
books.description: The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil. The fledgling F.B.I. intervened, ineffectively. Read by Will Patton, Ann Marie Lee and Danny Campbell. 9 hours, 45 minutes unabridged.
books.title: KILLERS OF THE FLOWER MOON

books.author: Jada Pinkett Smith
books.description: The actress and talk-show host describes personal and professional difficulties she encountered and her journey to finding self-love. Read by the author. 14 hours, 54 minutes unabridged.
books.title: WORTHY

books.author: Walter Isaacson
books.description: The author of “The Code Breaker” traces Musk’s life and summarizes his work on electric vehicles, private space exploration and artificial intelligence. Read by Jeremy Bobb. 20 hours, 27 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ELON MUSK

books.author: Michael Lewis
books.description: The author of “The Big Short” and “The Premonition” chronicles the rise and fall of Sam Bankman-Fried and FTX. Read by the author. 8 hours, 56 minutes unabridged.
books.title: GOING INFINITE

books.author: Rachel Maddow
books.description: The MSNBC host and co-author of “Bag Man” details a campaign to overthrow the U.S. government and install authoritarian rule prior to and during our involvement in World War II. Read by the author. 13 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: PREQUEL

books.author: Patrick Stewart
books.description: The Olivier Award-winning actor recounts his classical theater training and onscreen portrayals of the iconic roles of Jean-Luc Picard and Professor Charles Xavier. Read by the author. 18 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: MAKING IT SO

books.author: Kerry Washington
books.description: The Emmy Award-winning actor describes setbacks she faced and her journey to find a sense of belonging. Read by the author. 8 hours, 59 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THICKER THAN WATER

books.author: Cassidy Hutchinson
books.description: The former special assistant to President Trump and his chief of staff, Mark Meadows, details events surrounding the crisis of conscience she faced. Read by the author. 11 hours, 36 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ENOUGH

books.author: Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over 35 years. Read by the author. 6 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.contributor: by Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity. Read by Peter Attia. 17 hours, 8 minutes unabridged.
books.title: OUTLIVE

books.author: Jill Duggar with Derick Dillard and Craig Borlase
books.contributor: by Jill Duggar with Derick Dillard and Craig Borlase
books.description: A behind-the-scenes account of the reality TV series “19 Kids and Counting” and a portrayal of life inside the Duggar family. Read by Jill Duggar. 7 hours, 7 minutes unabridged.
books.title: COUNTING THE COST

books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery. Read by Sean Pratt. 16 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: Jennette McCurdy
books.description: The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother. Read by the author. 6 hours, 25 minutes unabridged.
books.title: I'M GLAD MY MOM DIED

books.author: John Stamos with Daphne Young
books.contributor: by John Stamos with Daphne Young
books.description: A memoir by the star of “Full House,” “ER” and “General Hospital.” Read by John Stamos. 8 hours, 44 minutes unabridged.
books.title: IF YOU WOULD HAVE TOLD ME

books.author: Rick Rubin with Neil Strauss
books.contributor: by Rick Rubin with Neil Strauss
books.title: THE CREATIVE ACT

books.author: Arthur C. Brooks and Oprah Winfrey
books.contributor: by Arthur C. Brooks and Oprah Winfrey
books.title: BUILD THE LIFE YOU WANT

books.author: Anderson Cooper and Katherine Howe
books.contributor: by Anderson Cooper and Katherine Howe
books.title: ASTOR

books.author: Rich Paul with Jesse Washington
books.contributor: by Rich Paul with Jesse Washington
books.title: LUCKY ME

books.author: Tatsuki Fujimoto
books.description: A student who is having trouble navigating high school might be brought into contact with Chainsaw Man.
books.title: CHAINSAW MAN, VOL. 12

books.author: Bill Watterson.
books.contributor: by Bill Watterson. Illustrated by Bill Watterson and John Kascht
books.contributor_note: Illustrated by Bill Watterson and John Kascht
books.description: A battered knight, who was sent on a mission with others by the king to uncover the source of calamities besetting the kingdom, is the only one who returns.
books.title: THE MYSTERIES

books.author: Ann M. Martin.
books.contributor: by Ann M. Martin. Illustrated by Ellen T. Crenshaw
books.description: The 14th book in the Baby-Sitters Club series. Members of the club have different reactions to visiting New York City.
books.title: STACEY'S MISTAKE

books.author: Rachel Smythe
books.description: While Zeus wants to bring Persephone to justice because of her bloody secret, Hades searches for her in the depths of the Underworld.
books.title: LORE OLYMPUS, VOL. 5

books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The 11th book in the Dog Man series. Piggy returns and the Supa Buddies are sabotaged.
books.title: TWENTY THOUSAND FLEAS UNDER THE SEA

books.author: Tatsuya Endo
books.description: A child who lives a somewhat unremarkable life might face great danger.
books.title: SPY X FAMILY, VOL. 10

books.author: John Patrick Green
books.description: The seventh book in the InvestiGators series. When a delirious cruise captain is found at sea, the search for his ship and its passengers gets underway.
books.title: INVESTIGATORS: ALL TIDE UP

books.author: Míriam Bonastre Tur
books.description: Twin witches Dani and Dorian, along with other members of the kingdom, band together to prevent darkness from having its way.
books.title: HOOKY VOL. 3

books.author: Naoya Matsumoto
books.description: While Reno seems to be further along in his training, conditions make it so Iharu is the one who must go into action.
books.title: KAIJU NO. 8, VOL. 8

books.author: Scott Cawthon, Kelly Parra and Andrea Waggener.
books.contributor: by Scott Cawthon, Kelly Parra and Andrea Waggener. Illustrated by Didi Esmeralda, Coryn MacPherson and Diana Camero

books.description: Three stories adapted into a graphic novel by Christopher Hastings.
books.title: FIVE NIGHTS AT FREDDY'S: FAZBEAR FRIGHTS, VOL. 3

books.author: Gege Akutami
books.description: The athletic Yuji Itadori chooses to spend his time with members of the Occult Research Club, who unseal a cursed object.
books.title: JUJUTSU KAISEN, VOL. 1

books.author: Ann M. Martin.
books.contributor: by Ann M. Martin. Illustrated by Katy Farina
books.description: The seventh book in the Baby-Sitters Little Sister series. A new haircut adds to Karen’s anxieties.
books.title: KAREN'S HAIRCUT

books.author: Aaron Blabey
books.description: The 17th book in the Bad Guys series. The wannabe heroes return and a major shift in perception takes place.
books.title: THE BAD GUYS IN LET THE GAMES BEGIN

books.author: Dan Conner.
books.contributor: by Dan Conner. Illustrated by Deborah Allo
books.description: Jack Skellington and Oogie Boogie go from being best friends to being bitter rivals.
books.title: THE BATTLE FOR PUMPKIN KING

books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The ninth book in the Dog Man series. After turning in his badge, the canine cop is determined not to just roll over.
books.title: GRIME AND PUNISHMENT

books.author: John Grisham
books.description: Two childhood friends follow in their fathers’ footsteps, which puts them on opposite sides of the law.
books.title: THE BOYS FROM BILOXI

books.author: Danielle Steel
books.description: After tragedy strikes, six adult children return to the family home without their parents for the first time.
books.title: THE WHITTIERS

books.author: Stacy Willingham
books.description: When teenage girls go missing, a psychologist in Baton Rouge grapples with echoes from her past.
books.title: A FLICKER IN THE DARK

books.author: Nicholas Sparks
books.description: Maggie Dawes, a renowned travel photographer, struggles with a medical diagnosis over Christmas.
books.title: THE WISH

books.author: Lisa Jewell
books.description: Libby Jones learns the identity of her parents and inherits a London mansion, but this comes with a mystery of multiple murders.
books.title: THE FAMILY UPSTAIRS

books.author: James Patterson and Mike Lupica
books.contributor: by James Patterson and Mike Lupica
books.description: As the Paris Olympics draw near, a mother and daughter, who are champion horse riders, compete against each other.
books.title: THE HORSEWOMAN

books.author: James Patterson and J.D. Barker
books.contributor: by James Patterson and J.D. Barker
books.description: A strange vibration rises out of a forest near Mount Hood.
books.title: THE NOISE

books.author: Mike Maden
books.description: The 16th book in the Oregon Files series. A criminal syndicate has a torpedo that could obliterate entire cities.
books.title: CLIVE CUSSLER'S HELLBURNER

books.author: Allison Brennan
books.description: The fourth in the Quinn and Costa thriller series. When women are killed in a small bayou town, a police detective calls in a favor from a friend on the F.B.I.’s Mobile Response Team.
books.title: SEVEN GIRLS GONE

books.author: Debbie Macomber
books.description: A pastor and a bartender discover a new passion when they switch jobs during the holidays.
books.title: THE CHRISTMAS SPIRIT

books.author: Lynsay Sands
books.description: The 36th book in the Argeneau series. Alasdair MacKenzie getting hit by a car and being poisoned might be a sign that someone is trying to keep him from claiming Sophie as his life mate.
books.title: BAD LUCK VAMPIRE

books.author: Lee Child and Andrew Child
books.contributor: by Lee Child and Andrew Child
books.description: The 27th book in the Jack Reacher series. Reacher goes after a killer but is unaware of the bigger implications.
books.title: NO PLAN B

books.author: Janet Evanovich
books.description: When her family’s home is threatened, Gabriela Rose goes with her ex-husband to seek lost treasure in the jungles of Peru.
books.title: THE RECOVERY AGENT

books.author: Nora Roberts
books.description: Two romance stories: “The Last Honest Woman” and “Dance to the Piper.”
books.title: MOONDANCE

books.description: The brutal murder of a teenager, and her mother's killing of the daughter's attacker, disturb an upscale Atlanta neighborhood.
